most_active_tickets.title: Pieces Copilot doesn't get the LTM info and shows a wrong date

common_issues.title: Pieces Copilot Inaccuracy and UI Bug with LTM
common_issues.description: Pieces Copilot inaccurately generates information when using the 'Start Copilot Chat' button in Workstream Activity view, sometimes pulling in unrelated topics even with provided context.  A UI bug also displays an incorrect date and time (Last Thursday) for the context. Specifying details like lecture name and number can improve accuracy.  The issue appears related to LTM (Long-Term Memory) functionality not being properly integrated with Copilot.

related_issues.title: Pieces Copilot doesn't get the LTM info and shows a wrong date
related_issues.text:
Pieces Copilot doesn't get the LTM info and shows a wrong date
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [ ] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.4.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After I did all my work with LTM turned on, I used the `Start Copilot Chat` button in the **Workstream Activity** View of Pieces Desktop. I asked it to generate some quiz questions based on what I studied, and it started talking about a lot of unrelated topics, even when the context was provided. Though when I started a new chat based on the context again and became more specific with the details such as lecture name and number (that was the one and only thing in the context I started the conversation with), it did it correctly. Also, all this while, the context time showed Last Thursday so I think there is an UI bug too. 

**Context Image:**
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ab732ff6-d195-4e81-a2af-6cee1e1d2032)

**Chat Image (Where it talks about unrelated topics):**
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8d6abd44-60a0-4f0c-9f8a-1cf1a887fd2e)

**Chat Image (Where it was fixed):**
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c7d86c81-ba0e-4ec3-8e2f-49a326ac232a)
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

related_issues.title: Issue with remote desktop
related_issues.text:
Issue with remote desktop
### Software

VS Code

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I encountered this issue while trying to use the piece extension in my WSL. The piece's extension gives issues anytime I try to use it in the Ubuntu remote desktop environment. This is an image of the issue it shows. I already tried the troubleshooting method on your website by creating a new port but it still didn't work.

![issue](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/dce2b29c-93cb-465c-8224-9d1b3ab795cc)

Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

recommendations: Prioritize resolving the Pieces Copilot inaccuracy and UI bug related to LTM, given its high frequency and activity level.
Investigate the integration of LTM with Copilot to address the root cause of the inaccuracy.
Address the UI bug displaying an incorrect date and time in the Workstream Activity view.
Review and update the documentation or user guides for Pieces Copilot, specifically regarding LTM integration and expected behavior.
Consider gathering more user feedback on the LTM feature to identify any other usability or functionality issues.
Monitor the activity levels of other reported issues, such as the remote desktop problem, and address them based on priority and impact.
Analyze the categories breakdown to identify trends and potential areas for improvement in the product or support processes (e.g., 'app:desktop application', 'os:macos').
